channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Marco Sciaini

item.title: Latitudinal Density Lines with R
item.description: Undirected Graphs Some problems Path Shortest path Cycle Ehler tour: A cycle that uses each edge excatly once. Hamilton tour: A cycle that uses each vertex exactly once classical NP-complete problem. Connectivity MST: Biconnectivity: A vertex whose removal disconnects the graph Planarity Graph isomorphism: Are two graphs identical? No one knows so far. A lonstanding open problem Representations Real-world graphs tend to be sparse (huge number of vertices, small average vertex degree).

item.title: VS Code and R
item.description: RStudio is (most likely, are there any numbers out there?) the most widespread IDE for R. However, getting more and more submerged into the R shiny world there was always a bit of a hassle toying around with R, HTML, CSS and Javascript. I was using VisualStudio Code for my blog and Jupyter notebooks and recently saw a tweet from Miles McBain Why would I use VSCode? Representations https://gist.
